page.title: 18Social Concerns
page.content: There is no evidence of poverty in this area. Most residents are very prosperous and there is no male unemployment in the area. There has been an increase in the number of young residents who look to the nearby city of Aberdeen to provide both education and employment since the oil industry arrived in the 1970's. This is a stable, mature society which does not readily take up new ideas which are seen by some as overtly fashionable and wholly urban concerns. One issue of concern is the condition of the environment. Residents, schools and District Council have worked hard together to build a strong awareness of the need to care for the area and its natural beauty.
